choices: The distribution of energy in a single Einstein solid.
A comparison of microstates and macrostates in a pair of dice.
The total multiplicity of microstates as a function of energy distribution in a system of two coupled Einstein solids.
The probability of obtaining a specific energy value in a single oscillator.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the key difference between the systems represented in Figure 2a and Figure 2b?
choices: The type of coupling between the two Einstein solids.
The number of oscillators and energy units in the system.
The temperature of each individual Einstein solid.
The method used to calculate the total multiplicity.
The probability of a specific energy configuration in an Einstein solid.
The total energy of an Einstein solid.
The number of microstates corresponding to a specific macrostate of an Einstein solid.
The temperature of an Einstein solid.

multiple_choice_question.text: What information does Table I convey about a pair of six-sided dice?
choices: The probability of each individual die landing on a specific face.
The relationship between the microstates and macrostates of the system.
The optimal betting strategy for the game of craps.
The physical properties that determine the fairness of a die.
